answers.author: Matthew Reges
answers.text:
Winchester, VA (26,000) recently completed a major renovation of its downtown pedestrian mall. Underground utility upgrades were the biggest expense, but they took the opportunity to make major surface and streetscape improvements. There was a lot of consultation with local business to inform the project plan, and work was planned for wintertime, to be completed before a major spring festival, with deadline incentives for contractors. Before the main street project began, street improvements were done on the parallel alley, and some businesses reversed their facades. While the main work was underway, the sidewalks mostly stayed open, and the wooden construction barriers were painted or muralized to add some interest. City staff sent regular emails and press releases with percentage status updates.   
Links:  
http://www.oldtownwinchesterva.com/about-old-town/contact/ 
http://www.winchesterva.gov/utilities/loudoun-street-project
Also the Economic Development Director and the Public Services Director. I lived and worked in the downtown area while planning was underway but left before major work started. I received city newsletters with project updates and can forward those emails as examples of public communication, if that's helpful.  
Good luck!

answers.author: Mark Abeles-Allison
answers.text:
Get your marketing professionals involved.  Special sales, events, use the uniqueness of the project, (ie: history, equipment, contractor, funding sources, etc) to bring people in to celebrate and patronize local business.  Be creative, create an entry arch with two backhoe shovels, have a contest on when the project will be done, share / display objects uncovered in the excavation (dig) process..

answers.author: John Zakian
answers.text:
Sorry for a delayed response.  The Downtown Development Authority in West Palm Beach would be a great resource.  The core street in the city's downtown, Clematis, recently under went a major disruption, arguably for the better, with the construction of a new City Hall on the street and there were serious disruptions for a considerable period of time.  The street as well as the downtown came through the process in good shape.  The DDA is a public authority with lead responsibility for marketing and promotion in the city's downtown.

author: Pamela Muse
text:
An Alliance member is interested in learning how you support your retail district businesses during construction projects:
1 - Ideas to support business in specialty retail district during construction projects that close the street in front of the businesses.
2 - Case studies or best practices of how Cities treat special events that use City property for their event (Parking lots & streets)
Appreciate your ideas, suggestions, brochures, documentation, etc dealing with retail/downtown construction projects affecting business.
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450 Office
480-231-3538 Text
pmuse@transformgov.org
www.transformgov.org
title: Retail District Businesses During Construction
